reviewText: This is totally a revenge, Fates warning is the best progressive band ever, with best lyrics and best music and even best band members. For those who appreciate music.. It is what you are looking for
Title: N/A

reviewText: Fates Warning 'Live In Athens' is an EXCELLENT DVD concert with good 'extras'!  What a treat and great privilege to have guitarists extraordinaire Frank X Aresti and Jim Matheos share the stage again with the powerful and mesmerizing Ray Alder!  Joey Vera and Nick D'Virgilio are excellent musicians as well.  The enthusiastic crowd in Athens was rabidly into the show, and reminded me of the loud and passionate Brazilian crowds on my Iron Maiden and Rush in Rio live DVD's.  Without a doubt, The Aresti/Matheos twin guitar assault is one of rock's most musical and revered matches, and their creativity and talent is second to none!
summary: A 'must own' for Fates Warning fans!  Clockwork!
Title: N/A

reviewText: The reason for the four stars would have to be the lack of stage performance from these guys.  Unlike Rush, let's say and their last two DVD's (reviewed seperately and both great), Fates Warning just gives you a straight ahead performance. Pretty cool seeing Nick from Spock's Beard and Mike from Dream Theater pounding the drums too.  Overall, if you're a Fates Warning fan and / or Ray Alder fan you'll enjoy this because you'll see them playing together and it's just great music. I saw them when they played with Queensryche and Dream Theater, but it was pretty low key because they were the opening band, but here you get to see by themselves so just turn it up and enjoy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: first C.o.C. release thier "first ever" live DVD w/ a new drummer after the original was there for 20 years and now after Zonder made FW a household name in progressive and thinking mans metal they choose to put out a DVD with a "fill in" drummer? Even if he is good - the little things Zonder added to the mix were so exciting and are sorely missed.I hope the next FW kicks up the speed and musicianship again. The metal world needs a complex Matheos back in a bad way. I met Zonder at the drum Pad in Illinois and he was awesome.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Although Fates Warning doesn't go for all the big stage props / visual effects, they put on one very tight, and heavy live effort here on "Live In Athens". Like many have stated, the dual axe attack of F. Aresti / J. Matheos are worth the purchace price alone. On top of those two battling, the set list is excellent...They scan alomost every era of their 20 years in Metal, and being that this was recorded just last year{2005}, it's amazing to see how much Fates may still have to offer today. This is a great live performace, and without question the best Fates has sounded in years...I've seen other various live Fates recordings, and none come close to touching this in terms of production or precision....
Title: N/A

reviewText: Fates has delivered an absolute wonderful DVD concert package. Great to see Aresti back where he belongs. The band smokes through some classic material and actually improves on some of the songs. Highlights include the passages from pleasant shade of grey, Pieces of me, Quietus and Another Perfect Day. The best moment was saved toward the end of the show. They played "Still Remains" and this song is a progressive masterwork. This song will make you realize why this band is known as a progressive force. This song features Kevin Moore who provides awesome keyboard work. The band is in fine form throughout- Alder, Matheos, and Vera!! Nick does a fairly good job of filling the mammoth shoes of Zonder. DantanaLantana should praise me for purchasing this for him.
summary: Sets the standard for all prog metal
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just can't say enough about these guys. The only other band that compares with them at present is Porcupine Tree. Love their performance. They are great songwriters and the musicianship is phenominal. I was a little disappointed that Mark Zonder didn't play drums though. Nick is a great drummer but Mark would have nailed it. But overall I was just glad to have something new from these guys. I kinda wish they would have played "River Wide Ocean Deep" or a couple of others from FWX but I am still very happy with this DVD. Jim Matheos has nearly finished working on the new OSI CD with Kevin Moore and Mike Portnoy, not sure who will be playing bass (the articles I read said nothing about Sean Malone being involved), but the CD should be out sometime early in 2006. I hope Jim does some more work with Gordian Knot also. Jim is fast becoming one of the best in the world alongside the greats like Robert Fripp, Steve Hackett, Steve Wilson, etc. I also really liked Ray Alder's work with Redemption on "The Fullness of Time". Great stuff. Also check out "Torn Between Dimensions" by At War With Self with Mark Zonder on drums. Highest Praises to the cover art of Travis Smith!
summary: Greatest Band Ever Alongside Porcupine Tree!
